title: Add This Garden Fresh Omelet to Your Morning Routine
excerpt: When you’re in a hurry, putting together a healthy, well-balanced breakfast can be difficult. This oftentimes leaves us with choosing the fastest – and most likely – the unhealthiest option in our cupboard. Want to change this habit? Chino Valley Ranchers can help!
author: Chino Valley Ranchers
content:
When you’re in a hurry, putting together a healthy, well-balanced breakfast can be difficult. This oftentimes leaves us with choosing the fastest – and most likely – the unhealthiest option in our cupboard. Want to change this habit? Chino Valley Ranchers can help! We have an easy and awesome garden fresh omelet recipe to share with you. To try out this simple and delicious recipe yourself, continue reading or watch our video recipe below!

What You’ll Need

  • Mushrooms
  • Red peppers
  • Spinach
  • Olive oil
  • Chino Valley Ranchers’ Cage-Free Egg Whites
  • Grated parmesan cheese

Optional Ingredients

  • Salt
  • Pepper

1. Prepare your vegetables.
Wash your mushrooms, red peppers and spinach. Then, add a small amount of water to a skillet, place it on the stove and set it to a medium heat. Once that is done, add the mushrooms, peppers, and spinach to the pan and make sure they are evenly distributed throughout the pan. Then, mix all the vegetables for approximately one minute. To add some flavor, sprinkle in some salt and pepper. Take the vegetables out of the skillet and place them on a heatproof dish.

2. Pour your egg whites.
Coat your empty skillet with a small amount of olive oil, and make sure that it is evenly applied over the entire skillet. Pour one carton of Chino Valley Ranchers’ Cage-Free Egg Whites into the skillet, and allow the egg whites to cook until it can be separated from the sides of the pan. Feel free to add some salt and pepper as well.

3. Put the finishing touches on your omelet.
While the egg whites continue to cook, place the vegetables back into the pan, trying to evenly distribute the mix of vegetables over the egg whites. Finally, take the omelet off the skillet and put it on a plate, folding the cooked egg whites over.

And that’s it! In three easy steps, you have yourself a healthy omelet that tastes delicious. The best recipes need the best ingredients, so be sure to buy your egg whites from Chino Valley Ranchers! To learn more about our quality eggs, give us a call today.
